title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The neighborhood. Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny ride down the street on their Big Wheels.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey, check it out, dude. Somebody bought the Donovans' old house.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah, I think they already moved in. I saw moving vans in their driveway two days ago.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I hope they're not Austrians. That's the last thing this town needs.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey look!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hello.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey. Do you live here?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah, I just moved here with my dad. Are you gonna be my new friends?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I really like your town. My dad wanted to move somewhere to get away from it all. He said he wanted piece and quiet, and to live with a bunch of hicks who don't know anything.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What's that you're wearing?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: It's my mask. My daddy says it's best for me to hide my face. My name's Blanket.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Your name is Blanket. Right. Well, Blanket, I'm Howdy Doody, and these are my friends Timsy , Winky  and Nod.  Unfortunately, we have to be off to the Land of Booger Trees, so we'll be leaving now.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Wait, don't you guys wanna come inside and play?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Huh look dude, we're in the fourth grade, okay? You know what that means? It means we don't hang out with a little kid. Come on, guys, let's get back to our Big Wheels.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We have arcade games inside.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The old Donovan house, now Blanket's home.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dad?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Whoa. Dude, no way.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh my God, this is awesome!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, are these all your toys?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, this is all my dad's stuff. He loves toys and video games.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, he must be loaded! What does he do?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: He's retired now.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh my God, dude! Your dad must be the coolest dad in the world!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on, my dad's probably out in the back yard.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The back yard. The sliding door opens up to a small park, a Neverland, with a giraffe, small Ferris wheel, small carousel, and other things. The boys step through the doorway

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh, kick ass! Dude, why isn't my house like this?!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dad, you out here??

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Here I am, Blanket!  Heeee!  Jeh chabee durtah!  Blanket!! Oh my beautiful blanket!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What's wrong with his face?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Be cool, dude. I, I think maybe he's a burn victim or something.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Guys, this is my dad, Michael Ja-

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Jefferson! Michael ...Jefferson, yeh. Hey, you wanna play with me?  Come on, let's climb the tree!  Come on, climb the tree, climb the tree!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: Have you been up my ...Wishing Tree? Tuh!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: It's where I come to think and dream.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: And now I'd like to show you my ...Wishing Tree. Jam on!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: Where we can laugh and giggle and scream. Hee hee!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson, your son can't get up.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Won't you imagine along with me?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We can be spacemen, or pirates on the sea Chuckajam on

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: Yes we can do everything, and I mean, everything! Chuckajam on

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: Up in my Wishing Tree! Hee hee! Ooooooooooooooooooooooooooooh!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stark's Pond, day. A group of kids skate around lazily on its frozen surface. Stan and friends race over a rise towards the lake

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey you guys! You guys!  You gotta come with us over to the Jeffersons!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jeffersons?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: They're a new family that just moved to South Park! We met this kid named Blanket, and he has the coolest dad in the world!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson said we can invite all the kids in town to go play over at their house.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: They have like, video games and rides and a cotton-candy machine, oh, and, and in their back yard, guess what they have in their back yard?? Guess. A train.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No way.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah way, Craig! And if you don't believe in Mr. Jefferson, then you can just not come!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I believe in Mr. Jefferson.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house, arcade room. As the kids enjoy the toys and games found there, Jefferson swings above them on a spacious swing with Bebe on his lap

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Weeeeeee, look at us on the swing! We're swinging!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Who wants the first cotton candy?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Memememememememememe...

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mememe! I'm first! I'm first!  Ooooh, let's go ride the choo-choo train!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Choo-choo train! Yay!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson back yard. The kids follow Jefferson to the train

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Let's ride the train! The train!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: Would you like to ride the train with me,

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yes I would, Mr. Jefferson. You're so awesome, Mr. Jefferson.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Cartman, you have a beautiful voice.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Thank you Mr. Jefferson. So do you.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: duet

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Let's ride and ride on the train together

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: ... Train together

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: On a journey through both of our minds.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: ... I've got time. Do youuu??

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: back near the sliding door, Stan, Kyle and Kenny look on. Blanket stands next to them and Kyle notices Blanket's left leg

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, what happened to your knee?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I fell down.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Choo-choo train, it's all fun and games.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Choo-choo train.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr.! Goddamnit. Here, come on. We need to clean that up.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The bathroom, nicely appointed. Kyle sits Blanket on the toilet and dresses the wound

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Alright, this is gonna sting for a second.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Ow!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I know, I know. Be cool.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Thank you. That already feels better.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: So, dude, do you have any brothers or sisters?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I have a half-brother and a half-sister. But they live with their mom now.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: And where is your mom?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I don't have a mom.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You must have a mom.  You mean she doesn't live here, or she's dead, or what?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No. I was made in a laboratory.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: My daddy wanted to have a baby, so he put me in a test tube. Then, they put me in a woman's tummy, and, when I was born, Daddy took me home.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: So you never met your mom?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Noo... But I used to have a lot of bodyguards and nannies, if that counts.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah. Yeah, that counts.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The neighborhood, some time later. The boys are walking home

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh man, that was great! You guys know what Mr. Jefferson said? He said I'm his best friend, and I can go over to his house whenever I want! I'm supposed to go right back over there after dinner tonight!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You guys, I feel kinda bad for that kid.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You feel bad for him?! He has everything a kid could want!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson just seems like he wants to be a kid, not have one.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh, you know what?! This makes perfect sense! A guy moves into South Park with a FERRIS wheel in his back yard, and KYLE has to see a problem with it! Mr. Jefferson is the best thing that's happened to this town in a long time, and if you miss this up, so help me GOD, I will rip your balls off with my bare hands! With my bare hands, Goddamn you!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stan's house, afternoon. Stan enters the kitchen through the back door. Randy is at the breakfast nook reading a paper, Sharon puts a coffee pot onto the counter

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well, there he is. Where have you been all afternoon.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I was over at the new neighbors, the Jeffersons.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh, are they nice people?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah. It's just a dad and his son.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well, we're supposed to have the Broflovskis and the Stotches over for dinner tonight. Maybe I'll invite Mr. Jefferson too.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stan's house, evening. The Marshes and their guests are seated at table for dinner. On screen left are seated Sheila, Chris and Linda. On screen right are seated Gerald, Mr. Jefferson, and Sharon, and Randy is at the head of the table

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: So, Mr. Jefferson, did I hear you say you moved here from Kentucky?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Kentucky, yeh.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I heard people saying you all were from Illinois.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, theh, they're ignorant. That's ignorant.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What kind of work do you do, Mr. Jefferson?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh I'm retired now, but, I was in... pharmaceuticals

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well our boys have really taken a liking to you. You seem to really have a way with them.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I just id- identify so much with children. Their innocence, their beauty. I think that God is in the face of every child.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: ....Yeeeah.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: ...They are fun.  Boys, you okay out there?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The living room. Stan, Kyle, and Blanket are seated on the sofa, eating

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Fine Mom.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Wow, these are great. What are they called again?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: They're TV dinners. Don't you wanna take that veil off so you can eat?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Nah, I'm not supposed to. Dad says I have to keep my face hidden.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What the hell is going on?! Are you having Mr. Jefferson over for dinner?!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, my parents are.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You guys better not be trying to Bogart my friend away!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: He is MY friend, got it?! I was friends with him before you assholes were, and I hoowi-  Stan! Stan, I'm serisouslih! You'd better not be talking bad about me in there to Mr. Jefferson!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The dining table

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey, you know Kobe Bryant was up in Eagle today.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh yeah? What do you think, Mr. Jefferson? Do you think Kobe's guilty or innocent?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: D'huh?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I think he's definitely going to jail. I just love seeing smug celebrities get their comeuppance.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I think it's wrong what the police do to wealthy black men.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh come on, Mr. Jefferson, you're not one of those who think that the police go around framing rich black people just because they're jealous..

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah! Because their hearts are full of greed and they have... doodoo in their soul.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Park County Police Station. Inside an officer waits for a fax to finish printing. As another officer walks by with a cup of coffee, he takes a sheet from the machine

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey Sergeant, take a look at this.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Whatcha got?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Looks like a new family has just moved into South Park. One Mr. Jefferson, age 50, bought a house there and paid cash. He seems to have a lot of money.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: So, what's the problem?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Take a look. Says here...  He's black.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: By God, so he is. Black and rich. Time to take this Mr. Jefferson down, just like we did Kobe.  Let's go people! We've got another rich black guy. I want him humiliated and dragged through the dirt, and I want it done by the books!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stan's house, night. Stan is asleep in his room when someone pounds at his window. Stan wakes up, then goes to the window

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Kyle?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey, Stan, whatcha doin'?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson- Awww!  It's 1:30 in the morning!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Look at me, I'm Peter Pan.  T-shamon! I'm a little boy forever.  Hey!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson, I have to go to school tomorrow!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh, son of a bitch! I knew it! What the hell are you doing, Stan?! I'll tell you what you're doing! You're trying to steal MY best friend!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: He just showed up here.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Remember, Mr. Jefferson? You said we were best friends.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Jesus Christ!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, look who I found prowling around in my back yard.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hi Stan.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: He was out all alone in the middle of the night. Mr. Jefferson isn't even home.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I know. He's here.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What??

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh Kyle, Blanket, yay, it's a slumber party!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No! Mr. Jefferson, you need to take your son home.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We can't go home. There's a ghost in our house. Me and Blanket are scared.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dad says it wants to eat us.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Please don't make us go back home. Please! We're scared, we're scared!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We're scared!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hee hee!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Okay, fine, we'll all stay here, but we're going to sleep now!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on, Blanket.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Now let's all sleep and dream Heehee! of fun and adventurous things shamon! It's time for us all to say goodnight

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Deeper.  Mr. Jefferson, I wish I could be around you all the time. You're awesome.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I think you're awesome too, Cartman.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Haaa!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What's the matter, Stan? Did you have a bad dream?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah. A really bad dream.  Oh Jesus!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house. An unmarked police car, blue in color, waits across the street. The sergeant's partner sips on a soda

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Murphy, you inside?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We're inside, sir. Harris was right. This guy looks like he has more money than all of us put together. Black sonofabitch! I'm planting the cocaine now.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Johnson, what about you?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Placing the blood spatter now, sir.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Frakes?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Placing pubic hair from the raped girl now, sir.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right, when this Jefferson guy shows up, arrest him fast and try not to beat him. There could be neighbors with video cameras.  Why do we do it, Harris?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Sir?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Why is it that us policement around the country have such a passion for framing wealthy African-Americans with crimes they didn't commit?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh why? I guess I never thought about why, sir. We just do it.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Twenty-five years I've been on the force. I've seen every kind of sick, depraved act known to humanity and still, when I see a black man walk by who has more money than me, I... want to vomit my gizzards right in the gutter. But why? Maybe there is no reason. Maybe there's just a big blue ball out there that's mostly covered with water and we're just goin' along for the ride.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stan's house, morning. Someone knocks on Stan's door.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stan, time to get up for school.  Stan? What the-?  Mr. Jefferson?!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh oh, we were just having a slumber party.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson, this is highly inappropriate!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Inappropriate? No, you're being ignorant. They're my friends. You see, I I didn't have a childhood, so I'm really just a child myself.  Here, everything's okay. I want you each to have a hundred dollars.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Wow, I'm gonna go buy that new sport coat I've been wanting.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on, Blanket. We have to go home and feed the animals. Bye, friends.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Boys, I do not want you going over to Mr. Jefferson's anymore. Do you understand?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You don't have to tell us twice, Mom. That guy's a freak!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Not go to Mr. Jefferson's anymore? Well, excuse my French, Mrs. Marsh, but you can suck my fat hairy balls!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The stakeout at Jefferson house, day. The two officers are snoring, but the sergeant is roused by the sound of a voice

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on, Blanket!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey Harris Harris Harris! Harris!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What what what?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: It's Jefferson! He's back!  All right, people. Let's give Blacky a nice welcome home.  Whoa, wait a minute!  That guy isn't black!  Holy God, his son isn't black either! Oh Jesus!  This is Yeats! Stand down! I repeat, stand down! Suspect is not black!  You son of a bitch, you told my this guy was African-American!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: It says right here on the final sheet he is!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Does that look like a black guy to you?!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: It said on the final sheet!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Jesus Christ Monkeyballs! We could have made an innocent man go to jail who wasn't black! Oh!  Wuuugh! Wuugh! Ohaugh. Ugh.  Jesus, Harris. What are we becoming? We're supposed to... protect the people. Where have we lost our way?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Sir, it's possible that he is black, even though he doesn't look it.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: To hell with you!! I'm never gonna frame an innocent man again! Unless I KNOW he's black for sure!!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Inside the house, Mr. Jefferson closes all the windows and curtains

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All the adults are trying to get us. Get up to your room, Blanket, and put your mask on! We can't go outside anymore!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: That poor kid.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, come on. We're not supposed to go over there.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hi guys!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hey Blanket. Uh, look, we're goin' over to help my dad chop wood. You... wanna come with?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Really? You mean it?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh yay, my friends are here! Come inside and play, guys!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Ah, actually, Mr. Jefferson, we were seeing if Blanket wanted to chop wood with us.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Chop wood? No, that's ignorant. That's poopie work. Blanket and me wanna play!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson, ih it might be good for Blanket to learn how to chop wood

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Blanket likes to play, don't you Blanket? Wee, look! He can fly!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Jesus Christ, dude!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Aaaaaah!!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Stop, you fucking lunatic!!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, we have got to get that kid away from him!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Blanket's room. He's crying on a giant plush teddy bear. Mr. Jefferson tries to soothe him

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, Blanket, shhhh. Stop crying. It's okay, Blanket. Here, look.  Jeekabee durtah!  Ow!  There, Blanket, shhhh. Hey, hey look, hey look.  I got your nose.  Look! Lookit, I got your nose. I got your nose, Blanket. See?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Aaaaaaaa!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, Blanket, stop!  It's ignorant. You're being ignorant!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Sergeant's house, later. He enters. A woman appears moments later.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Harrison, why haven't you called? You know how I worry.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I'm givin' up, Maggie. I'm quitting the force.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Quitting the force? You?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: None of it makes sense anymore.  I don't even know if what we're doing is right. The last thirteen hours we've been working on a case, trying to get a real scumbag off the streets. And when he walked up to the door, I could have sworn he was white. Maybe I can't tell the difference anymore. Maybe it doesn't matter. Because it seems like every time we frame a rich black guy, he's back out on the streets in no time. It's just like OJ. Do you know how hard those cops worked to frame him? The tireless hours they put in?? And then he just gets off because somebody messed up and said the N word out loud too many times. I guess I'm just tired. I'm jast damn tired.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Not another word of that kind of talk, Harrison Yeats.  Believe me I would love nothin' more than to have you quit the force and no longer have to worry about whether or not you're comin' home. But I know you. Framin' rich black men for crimes they didn't commit is in your blood. Wipin' that rich, smug smile off their faces is the only thing that puts a smile on yours. You're a good cop, Harrsion Yeats. You don't have to question that. Because I'm here to tell you.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: And you're a good wife, Maggie. You know me better than I know myself.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Where're you goin'?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Think I've got a little more work to do.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house, night. Cartman walks up to the door and knocks

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson? It's your best friend in the whole wide world, Eric Cartman. Mr. Jefferson? I came to sleep over tonight, remember?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson room. He's on the phone with someone.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No, Dr. Nelson, I'm telling you, you have to fly out here right now! My nose came off again!  I know you live in California; I'll pay for your plane ticket!  But I'm falling apart! I need some more of that cream and the injections! I have to look young again!  Oh, I'm melting!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house, outside. A ladder is propped up against the side of the house. Kyle, Stan, and another boy approach. The boy wears the same mask Blanket usually does.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right. Thanks a lot for helping us, dude.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah, sure, whatever.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You just gotta pretend you're Blanket until we can get the real Blanket somewhere safe.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Aren't I too big to be Blanket?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: I don't think Mr. Jefferson pays enough attention to his son to notice. Come on!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Blanket's bedroom. Blanket silently cries and the door creaks open

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Blanket, you in here?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hi guys!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Shh, Blanket, we're gonna take you away for a little while, okay?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You are? Oh thank you thank you thank you!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right dude, get in his bed.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right, but you guys owe me for this.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dude, whatever. At least you finally get to do something.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Santa Barbara Police Department, Snetzl's desk. His phone rings and he picks up

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Santa Barbara Police Department, this is Snetzl.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Park County Police Department, Yeats' desk.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hello, this is Sergeant Yeats over at the Park County Police Department in Colorado.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yes, sergeant. What can I do for you?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well, we've been trying to frame this guy who just moved into our town, and the fil-o-fax says he moved from yoru area. One Martin Jefferson?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hm. No, we never had a any rich African-Americans named Jefferson here. If we had, we would have framed him ourselves.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well, he doesn't really look that black.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah, I don't uh... Hold on a second. There was oine we framed a couple of times, but the black bastard was so rich he made bail and disappeared before the trial.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You say he disappeared? What did you frame him for?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: We uhhh found some kids that had stayed over at his place, and we asked them to lie and make up some false molestation charges.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Molestation, nice.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Yeah, it was a lot of work. Took years, but we were finally able to arrest him. Then we planted some evidence, took embarassing photos of his penis, and threw him in a dirty prison cell with doodie feces on the walls. You should have seen him squirm!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: That's damn fine police work, sergeant. Damn fine.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Heh yeah, but the point is this guy didn't really look black either. We had to sneak in while he was asleep and get a DNA sample to be sure.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Jesus Christ Monkeyballs! It must be the same guy!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house. Cartman knocks on the front door again

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Mr. Jefferson, hello??

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The bathroom. Stan, Kyle, and Blanket prepare a carry-on bag.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on, Blanket! We gotta go before your dad sees us.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What are you doing with my Blanket? Come on, Blanket, play with me. Jeechabee durtah! Hee!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: HAAAAA!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Go go RUUN!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Sutah!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Hallway. The boys run towards the stairs

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: HAAAAA!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Wuchatennah! Jamonah! Heehee!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh Jesus!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: What the hell is going on, you guys?

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: My Blanket! Let's play, Blanket!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Nonono wait, I'm not Blanket!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Wee, he can fly! He can fly!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Aaaah! Aaaah, stop! A-

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Oh my God, they killed Kenny!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You bastard!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Blanket? Blanket! Come play!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Nooo!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Come on!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: The Jefferson house, front lawn. Kyle opens the front door and the boys exit

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Run Blanket Run!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Ah!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dainduh! Dainduh Dainduh!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Hang on, Blanket!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Dugh! Heehee! Ja-!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Freeze, Jefferson! The gig is up! You are wanted for child mo-les-tation!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: No! I am sick and tired of people harassing Mr. Jefferson!  All I've been hearing since Mr. Jefferson moved here are sick lies! That he molests children, that he's a bad father, that he has plastic surgery!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: It's ignorant.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Sure, maybe Mr. Jefferson's a little different. But that's because he had to work all the time when he was young and missed out on his childhood. What's wrong with wanting to have the innocence and beauty of a child.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right, let's just say all the bad things said about Mr. Jefferson are lies! Let's say the police department does just go around spending their time framing people for crimes they didn't commit!  Let's say it's all made up, and Mr. Jefferson is just a nice guy who's trying to be a child because he never got to have a childhood. Well that's fine, except for that he HAS children now! And when people have children, they have to grow up!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: You're right. I've been so obsessed with my childhood that I've forgotten about his. I thought having lots of rides and toys was enough, but... Blanket doesn't need a playmate. He needs a father, and a normal life. Chickuckoo gainuh.  Blanket, I wanna give away all my money. I I wanna get a normal job and... take a shot at raising you in a normal setting.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Look everybody! I'm a normal little boy.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Well, if you're gonna give away all your money, then, I guess we can drop all those charges. No point in putting another poor black man in jail.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: All right! Things just might work out!

title: THE JEFFERSONS
text: Things can always work out, as long as we know we have the power to change.

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: We all have the power to change if we search inside our hearts

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: And we start to heal the wounds of all our yesterdays

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: And you know it might be hard, but all you've got to do is start,

title: THE JEFFERSONS
role: And you can change all of your evil molesting ways.
